dt: used as a code word for the letter {it}i{/it}

shortdef: —used as a code word for the letter i

dt: large peninsular region that is usually referred to as a {d_link|subcontinent|subcontinent} and is located in southern Asia south of the Himalayas between the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea; occupied by the countries India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh and formerly often considered to include Burma (but not Ceylon)
those parts of the peninsula of India that until 1947 were under British rule or protection together with Baluchistan, the Andaman Islands, the Nicobar Islands and, prior to 1937, Burma

country comprising the major portion of the peninsula; a republic within the Commonwealth of Nations; until 1947 a part of the British Empire; capital New Delhi {it}area{/it} 1,269,219 square miles (3,287,263 square kilometers), {it}population{/it} 1,296,834,000

shortdef: large peninsular region that is usually referred to as a subcontinent and is located in southern Asia south of the Himalayas between the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea; occupied by the countries India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh and formerly often considered to include Burma (but not Ceylon)
those parts of the peninsula of India that until 1947 were under British rule or protection together with Baluchistan, the Andaman Islands, the Nicobar Islands and, prior to 1937, Burma

country comprising the major portion of the peninsula; a republic within the Commonwealth of Nations; until 1947 a part of the British Empire; capital New Delhi area 1,269,219 square miles (3,287,263 square kilometers), population 1,296,834,000

dt: {bc}a solid black pigment (such as specially prepared lampblack) used in drawing and lettering
{bc}a fluid ink consisting usually of a fine suspension of india ink in a liquid

a fluid ink consisting usually of a fine suspension of india ink in a liquid

dt: {bc}a {d_link|pale ale|pale ale} made with extra hops {bc}{sx|ipa||}

dt.t: The hoppy extreme of pale ale is best represented by the enormous bitterness of so-called {wi}India pale ale{/wi} (IPA).

shortdef: a pale ale made with extra hops : ipa

dt: {bc}a thin absorbent paper used especially for proving inked intaglio surfaces (such as steel engravings)

a thin tough opaque printing paper

dt: the part of India formerly under direct British administration {dx}see {dxt|indian states||}{/dx}

dt: former group of 89 Indian states in north central India; capital Indore; area now chiefly in western and northern Madhya Pradesh (state)

dt: former French possessions in India including Chandernagore (ceded to India in 1950) and Puducherry, Karikal, Yanam, and Mahé (ceded to India in 1954); capital Puducherry

shortdef: former French possessions in India including Chandernagore (ceded to India in 1950) and Puducherry, Karikal, Yanam, and Mahé (ceded to India in 1954); capital Puducherry

dt: three former Portuguese possessions at some distance from each other along the western coast of India that were annexed by India in 1961: the territory of Goa (primarily on the mainland, with a few small offshore islands and a section surrounded by water at high tide), the district of Daman (on the mainland), and the district of Diu (an island together with a small part of the adjacent mainland)

shortdef: three former Portuguese possessions at some distance from each other along the western coast of India that were annexed by India in 1961: the territory of Goa (primarily on the mainland, with a few small offshore islands and a section surrounded by water at high tide), the district of Daman (on the mainland), and the district of Diu (an island together with a small part of the adjacent mainland)
